title: Oxfordshire Live: Tuesday 4 October - BBC News
summary: police have received a 'substantial quantity of information after oxford schoolgirl rape .
`` savage '' murder part of an attempt to steal first edition of the wind in the willows , a court has heard .
voters have until midnight to register for witney by-election .

documents.title: that 's all from oxfordshire live
text: many thanks for joining us today .
we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow with all the day 's latest headlines from across oxfordshire .
look forward to seeing you then .

documents.title: abingdon vet makes tv debut
text: abingdon vet daniel preece is currently a new face on our tv screens after appearing in an advert for vets4pets following a series of auditions and screen tests .
mr preece said he was in `` complete shock '' after being chosen .
`` i brought along one of my clients , jack the 15-year-old collie , to be my co-star .
he was the real star of the advert and actually helped me with my nerves on the day .
`` finishing filming was definitely a proud moment for me .
i 've made sure to tell all my family and friends know about the advert , and i am excited to see it on my television . ''

documents.title: aviation and motoring centre plans rev up at raf bicester
text: a national centre for aviation and motoring excellence will be built at raf bicester .
cherwell district council 's executive agreed to adopt a heritage partnership agreement ( hpa ) between the council and bicester heritage .
the organisation has plans to repair and conserve more than 60 buildings and structures on the site .
without the hpa , bicester heritage would have needed to apply to cherwell for a repeated series of listed building consents .
the site was home to raf bomber command in world war ii and became redundant in 2004 .

documents.title: frideswide square up for national award
text: oxford 's redesigned frideswide square has been shortlisted for a national award .
work to repair damaged kerbs was done in august and september , less than a year after the £ 6.7m project was completed .
despite this , the square has been shortlisted for the national transport times awards - held annually to celebrate the successes that have been achieved on national and local transport projects .

documents.title: warning over tax man scam
text: a warning has been issued over a phone scam in which fraudsters pose as investigators from hm revenue and customs .
the fraudster tells unsuspecting victims they are under investigation and are due in court .

the automated phone message then asks you to press one to speak to a case officer , which then diverts the call to a premium-rate number which may tot up very expensive charges on the victims ' phone bills .

people are being urged to hang up immediately and not press one on their phone , then report the incident to action fraud , the uk 's national fraud and cyber-crime reporting centre on 0300 123 2040 or at www.actionfraud.police.uk .

documents.title: travel latest : oxford traffic building on all routes
text: city centre building on all outbound routes , v slow on the # woodstock rd to # wolvercote rdbt # botley rd to # westway # headleyway , # london rd

documents.title: roadworks delayed after bats found in tunnel
text: roadworks near the milton interchange have been delayed until the new year after bats were found in a tunnel .
the pipistrelle bats are a protected species and were discovered at the backhill tunnel .
the work is now scheduled to begin immediately after the christmas period during the first week of january .
the reason for delaying the start of main works is that an ecological survey identified that pipistrelle bats are present in the vicinity of backhill tunnel .
the bats are a nationally protected species - we are reviewing the design , in particular the lighting design which , if inappropriate , may disturb roosting and hibernating bats .

documents.title: repairs to railway cables destroyed by fire
text: work has begun to replace cables damaged by a fire overnight on the rail line into london .
chiltern railways says it hopes to run normal timetable tomorrow , but operations and safety director andrew munden said there could still be some changes in the morning .
check the chiltern railways website for more details .
the fire-damaged cables affecting @ twitterid services between birmingham and marylebone .
repairs will be underway soon .
are the repairs likely to be completed for the am service tomorrow ?
need to get to h-wyc from ldn by 8am
we are doing all we can to reopen asap .
check with @ twitterid or @ twitterid for the latest info before travelling .
repairs to the fire-damaged cables are well underway and will continue , along with testing , overnight .
@ twitterid # marylebone
excellent work and well done to all involved in very challenging circumstances : )
good work , but it 's now time to raise our aspirations .
reopen ardley station now !

documents.title: witney voters have until midnight to register for by-election
text: people in witney who want to vote in the upcoming by-election have until midnight tonight to register .
constituents will go to the polls on the 20th to vote for who they want to replace david cameron .
those who were already registered to vote in the eu referendum can rest easy as they are already registered .

documents.title: 'substantial quantity ' of information in oxford schoolgirl rape inquiry
text: police investigating the abduction and rape of a schoolgirl in oxford say they have received a `` substantial quantity '' of information from the public .
thames valley police was reviewing a `` great deal '' of cctv and dash cam footage .
the 14-year-old was raped after being snatched on her way to school between 08:15 and 08:40 bst last wednesday .
high visibility patrols are continuing in the summertown area to gather `` further witness information '' .

documents.title: wantage girl wins inspiration award
text: a nine-year-old girl from wantage received a wellchild award last night and got to meet prince harry .
mikayla beames was diagnosed with brain cancer when she was four and is registered blind and won in the category of inspirational child .
the awards celebrate the courage of children coping with serious illnesses or complex conditions .
her mother natasha said mikayla 's slogan was : `` dream , pray , miracles all the way . ''

documents.title: man killed 'for wind in the willows book '
text: man killed 'for wind in the willows book '

documents.title: adrian greenwood stabbing : victim appeared to be 'perfect target '
text: prosecutor oliver saxby qc has told a jury at oxford crown court how michael danaher repeatedly searched the internet for `` adrian greenwood '' , `` rare books oxford '' and `` wind in the willows '' towards the end of last year .
according to bank records in the early hours of 16 december he also bought a stun gun disguised as a mobile phone , the barrister added .
mr saxby said : `` the more he looked into adrian greenwood , the more of a perfect target he must have seemed .
`` here was an immensely valuable book in a house that was n't quite so fortified as those around it , and a man living alone . ''

documents.title: £ 500 prize on offer for teens in crimestoppers talent contest
text: teenagers are being encouraged to sign up to a new x-factor-style talent competition launched by the crimestoppers charity .
young people aged 11 to 16 could win a prize bundle worth £ 500 , including cinema passes , paintballing tickets , nando 's vouchers , a go pro , beats headphones and a tablet .
the competition - which will see entrants upload two-minute videos of their performances to youtube - is being launched to coincide with the service 's new website .
more information on the competition can be found by visiting www.fearless.org/famebyfearless/thamesvalley .

documents.title: appeal to trace stolen silver from appleford church
text: have you seen these precious items ?
they were stolen from the church of st peter and st paul in appleford , near abingdon , between 21 august and 12 september .
if you 've seen them , call police on 101 , quoting reference number 43160252981 .
or , call crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555111 .

documents.title: your the manger at white horse hill
text: hedley thorne has sent in this stunning of the valley known as the manger from white horse hill .
have you got a you 'd like to share with us ?
please send it to oxfordshire @ bbc.co.uk .

documents.title: rail update : chiltern railways hopes to run normal timetable tomorrow
text: after the fire overnight in london which took out signalling , chiltern railways says it hopes to be operating a normal timetable from tomorrow .
it warns though that with trains and crews in the wrong place there could be some disruption or some trains may be the wrong length so may feel busier .
things could change and passengers are advised to check the company 's website later .

documents.title: sexual consent courses now described as compulsory at oxford university
text: freshers starting at oxford university this week will now have to attend compulsory sexual consent workshops .
though the sessions have been around for a few years , this is the first time that every undergraduate common room plans to run them .
some have reacted with surprise that such a prestigious institution should need to teach some of britain 's finest young minds that `` no means no '' .
but the university authorities backed the students union to organise the course .

documents.title: who wants you to vote ? # bbcunsunghero
text: we 've got just under three weeks to go now until the deadline for the bbc unsung hero award .
see which multi-medal-winning british athlete is urging you to get those nominations in now
to download or request a nomination form - and more details about the award - read here .

documents.title: defends university challenge quiz
text: defends university challenge quiz

documents.title: action needed 'on dangerous a34 '
text: action needed 'on dangerous a34 '

documents.title: adrian greenwood stabbing : defendant 'posed as parcel deliveryman '
text: mr saxby said mr danaher had already tried on 22 march to enter the house of adrian beecroft , also on his list of targets , by arriving with a parcel he said was for his daughter .
he told the jury mr beecroft 's wife realised something was wrong and screamed for help when he tried to push past her into her house .
on that occasion mr danaher fled the scene , mr saxby added .
author: Joe Nimmo
BBC News

documents.title: michael danaher 'plotted ' adrian greenwood murder
text: prosecutor oliver saxby qc told the court the defendant , who was out of work and experiencing money problems when he allegedly killed mr greenwood , had no previous criminal convictions .
but he said : `` as of late 2015 , alone in his flat , on the internet , often late at night , he was plotting .
`` plotting to get money by committing crimes , really serious crimes with victims . ''
when police examined mr danaher 's phone and laptop they found e-books with titles like hacking for profit , opening locks without keys and the technique of silent killing , mr saxby said .
author: Joe Nimmo
BBC News

documents.title: adrian greenwood 'had criminal convictions for assault '
text: other items mr greenwood had for sale included signed wartime photographs of winston churchill , a first illustrated edition of frankenstein , an oil painting by george bernard shaw , and a 16th century bible .
mr danaher admits killing mr greenwood but says it was in self-defence .
mr saxby listed three criminal convictions the book dealer had for assault and battery and acknowledged that he `` had a temper , which from time to time he lost '' .
but he added that he had `` no track record of using or threatening serious violence '' .
author: Joe Nimmo
BBC News

documents.title: adrian greenwood stabbing : the 'people of means ' list
text: other people on the so-called 'people of means ' list mentioned at oxford crown court , in addition to jeffrey archer and kate moss , are :
the weapon listed in many cases was `` stun gun '' , and one was found in michael danaher 's flat by police .
author: Joe Nimmo
BBC News

documents.title: art dealer 's 'savage ' murder was over wind in the willows book
text: the `` savage '' murder of a rare book dealer was part of an attempt to steal a £ 50,000 first edition of the wind in the willows , a court has heard .
adrian greenwood , 42 , was found in the hallway of his four-storey oxford house on 7 april .
he had been fatally stabbed in the chest and neck .
michael danaher , 50 , of hadrians court , peterborough , is on trial at oxford crown court and denies murder .

documents.title: adrian greenwood stabbing : accused 'had list of wealthy people '
text: prosecutor oliver saxby qc said michael danahar had also targeted jeffrey archer and kate moss .
his intention was `` to get money '' by going to the houses of wealthy people and robbing them , he said .
a spreadsheet was found on the defendant 's computer with the names of 14 `` people of means '' who he intended to steal from or kidnap .
mr saxby said the list was `` considered in its own way , and efficient , and really quite brutal '' and also had details of valuables , weapons and family members of his planned victims .
he told the jury : `` note its tone .
it exudes a certain sense of resentment , even anger .
it is almost as if these are people who , because of their wealth , and his lack of it , deserve to be subjected to what he has planned . ''
mr saxby said mr greenwood 's name was on the list next to a note that read : `` modus : any ! !
expected take : rare books . ''
author: Joe Nimmo
BBC News

documents.title: adrian greenwood 's killing 'cool , calculated , controlled '
text: adrian greenwood 's body had been beaten , repeatedly stabbed , and stamped on , oxford crown court has heard .
oliver saxby qc said : `` it takes a certain sort of person to have done what the defendant did to adrian greenwood .
`` cool , calculated , controlled , before , during and after .
and underpinning it all ?
greed .
it was money he was after . ''
the trial is expected to last three weeks .
author: Joe Nimmo
BBC News

documents.title: highways england to 'carefully consider suggestions ' on a34
text: following last night 's meeting of the a34 action group , highways england has released a statement .
safety is our top priority and we look forward to hearing the ideas of oxfordshire county council and other bodies including the police .
we will carefully consider any suggestions that are made .

documents.title: oxfordshire restaurants and pubs in latest michelin guide
text: restaurants and pubs across oxfordshire feature in the latest edition of the prestigious michelin guide great britain and ireland .
author: Oxford Times

documents.title: alternate travel around chiltern railways disruption
text: major disruption to and from london # marylebone until the end of service

documents.title: father and son swim channel
text: a father and son from cote , near bampton , have swum across the english channel for charity .

james salter and 16-year-old son harry , a student at radley college , reached calais yesterday afternoon after facing high tides and strong currents during the challenge in aid of the charlie waller memorial trust .
they took turns to swim two hours each during the crossing .
due to rough conditions they took a route that was six miles longer , covering 27 miles in all .

documents.title: mps to 'put pressure ' on government to improve a34
text: a conservative mp has vowed to put pressure on highways england and the department for transport to make improvements on the a34 a priority .
in august , five people and an unborn boy were killed on the road , sparking the creation of a community action group to campaign for changes to the road .

speaking at a meeting on monday evening , newbury mp richard benyon said he and his oxfordshire colleagues would continue to debate the a34 and pressure the department for transport to improve safety .

documents.title: new westgate will put 'huge pressure ' on roads
text: an increase in the number of shoppers at oxford 's westgate centre from five million to 16 million will put huge pressure '' on the transport system , according to the city 's pedestrian association .
author: Oxford Mail

documents.title: banbury commuters delayed by cable fire
text: fast trains to london marylebone cancelled from # banburystation due to fire nr neasden .
@ bbcoxford

documents.title: repairs following cable fire to take at least 24 hours
text: we have more information on the major cable fire that has been disrupting chiltern railways services today .

it 's not known what caused the fire but it was reported on the kilburn railway viaduct at about 04:00 , destroying data and power cables which took out all the signalling between marylebone and neasden junction .
at 08:00 firefighters were still damping down the blaze , and repairs are likely to take at least 24 hours
area director martin ball said : `` engineers will make the necessary repairs as soon as they are safely able to do so .
i know how frustrating incidents like this are for travelling customers , who are at the front of our mind as we seek to fix this problem . ''

documents.title: 'average speed cameras and crawler lane needed for a34 '
text: mps , residents and councillors are campaigning for highways england to install an hgv crawler lane and average speed cameras on the a34 , after a spate of harrowing crashes that led to the deaths of four children , a mother , and an unborn boy .
councillor stewart lilly , who attended an a34 community action group meeting on monday , said : `` doing nothing is not an option . ''

documents.title: travel update : slow around wolvercote and cutteslowe
text: there 's slow traffic on the a40 in both directions in oxford between the wolvercote roundabout and cutteslowe roundabout .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: mourners pack church for funeral of popular councillor
text: more than 100 mourners packed out a church in minster lovell to say farewell to district councillor warwick robinson at his funeral .
author: Oxford Mail

documents.title: witney care home resident , 82 , returns to the waters
text: staff at a witney care home helped an 82-year-old resident with parkinson 's disease get swimming again after a six-year break from the hobby .
author: Witney Gazette

documents.title: travel update : traffic slow in in kingston bagpuize
text: there 's slow traffic on the a420 eastbound in kingston bagpuize at the a415 junction .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: swindon and oxford set for derby tonight
text: oxford united have a chance to make it seven wins in a row against their local rivals swindon tonight , but their manager is prioritising success in league one .

the checkatrade trophy is subject to a fans boycott because of the introduction of premier league `` b '' teams this season and tonight 's all-ticket clash at the county ground could generate the derby 's lowest ever gate .
united boss michael appleton says he respects the rivalry , but will make changes to his side as he 's more concerned about protecting players than protecting the winning run against swindon .
the reality is , it 's our first time back in league one for god knows how long and we want to do as well as we possibly can .

documents.title: changes to make a34 safer discussed
text: the a34 action group has held its second meeting to push for changes to the a34 , which runs from hampshire to oxfordshire , to make it safer .
it 's been set up after several deaths on the road over the summer .
proposals discussed on monday night at chilton village hall in oxfordshire included a crawler lane and average speed check cameras .

documents.title: travel update : delays at hinksey hill
text: there 's delays on the a34 in both directions at the hinksey hill interchange .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: chiltern railways : 'avoid travelling with us today '
text: a fire has closed the main railway from north oxfordshire into central london .
there is no direct service from banbury , bicester and oxford parkway to marylebone .
the line side fire at neasden has affected signalling .

because of the scale of the problem we 've got we are unable to run a full service on the remainder of the route , and we are advising people where at all possible to either delay their journeys , or avoid travelling with us today .

documents.title: travel update : delays at headington roundabout
text: there are delays on the a40 london road westbound in headington at the headington roundabout .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : breezy but warm
text: the thick and patchy fog will lift and it will become a bright and sunny day .
it 'll be breezy but warm in the sunshine .
maximum temperature 17c ( 63f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel update : chiltern railways disruption
text: due to a cable fire services to & from london will be severely disrupted .
ticket acceptance on virgin , london midland , crosscountry and gwr
- are trains running from w ruislip to wycombe ?
yes , what time are you looking to travel ?
bl
- around 4pm
from w. ruislip to wycombe around 4pm will be at 16:15 , 16:23 , 16:34 and 16:53 .

we are running the services we can , due to the severe disruption they can not run as normal at present .

documents.title: prosecution to begin in art dealer murder trial
text: the prosecution is due to open its case against michael danaher at the crown court later - he is accused of murdering oxford art dealer adrian greenwood .
mr greenwood , 42 , was found in the hallway of his four-storey house in the city on 7 april .
he had been stabbed in the chest and neck .
he was an oxford graduate who had written two historical biographies and traded rare books as well as art .
mr danaher , 50 , of hadrians court , peterborough , appeared at the first day of the trial on monday and denies murder .

documents.title: good morning
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live for oxfordshire on this foggy tuesday morning .
stick with us as we update you on the breaking stories for the county throughout the day .
you can get in touch with us via email , facebook or twitter .
